name: Westminster Brewing Co
description: Imagine a little, community-focused brewery looking to make   thirsty neighbors and friends a great product, then find it tucked   away in a casual, friendly setting and you are at the Westminster   Brewing Company! Located in our namesake city on the Front   Range of awesome Colorado, this production brewery's main   objective is to serve our community and help craft beer fans,   both seasoned and the newly initiated, find the varieties and   flavors they desire.

name: Weston Brewing Company
description: The Weston Brewing Company was first established in 1842 by German immigrant John Georgian. Georgian brought the tradition of lager brewing with him when he settled in Weston. The brewery was designed to utilize ice from the river during winter and lagering cellars dug deep into the ground to create ideal conditions for his beer which needed to be stored below 60 degrees for more than six weeks. In creating the brewery, the Weston Brewing Company became one of the first lager breweries in the United States.

name: H Weston & Sons Ltd
description: "Today, our traditionally produced, award winning draught and bottled products are not only available throughout the UK, but are exported to more than 40 countries worldwide. From supermarkets to local off licences, in hotels, restaurants, pubs and clubs you will find Westons products, continuing in our heritage of quality."

name: Westport Brewing Company
description: Westport Brewing Company is the first microbrewery on the Washington Coast since 1944 when Pacific Brewing Company closed its doors. Emulating traditional brewing conditions, we brew our beer with local water without amendments, regionally grown hops, and domestic malts. We take advantage of our unique location, on a peninsula between the Pacific Ocean and Grays Harbor, to ferment our beer in polyethylene fermenters at ambient temperatures. This results in smooth, clear, unhurried beer with sparkling clarity, deep, complex flavor profiles, and remarkable consistency between styles.    We currently brew 19 styles of beer and are always exploring new recipes to appeal to the craft-wise thirsty palates of the region.    We currently brew in a 3-Barrel brewhouse but have plans to expand in the near future.    Our brewery welcomes visitors Thursday through Monday, noon to 6PM, each week to sample our wide variety of beer, visit with Mark and Robin and enjoy the beauty of Westport and the Washington Coast!
hoursOfOperation: Mon: 12:00 pm - 6:00 pm  Thu - Sun: 12:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Westvleteren Abdij St. Sixtus
description: The Westvleteren Brewery is a Belgian brewery founded in 1838 inside the Trappist Abbey of Saint Sixtus of Westvleteren in the Belgian municipality of Vleteren, not far from the hops-producing town of Poperinge and the medieval city of Ypres. The brewery and its beers are usually referred to as Westvleteren. The brewery's three beers have acquired an international reputation for taste and quality, being considered by a percentage of beer aficionados and judges to be "the best beer in the world" (for Wesvleteren XII, a Quadrupel) as well as the limited availability of the beers which are not brewed to normal commercial demands, but are sold in small quantities weekly from the doors of the monastery itself, to individual buyers after reservation only.

name: Wet 'N Reckless Brewing
description: A nanobrewery that makes awesome interesting beer and provides a nice place to drink it
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Fri: 3:30 pm - 10:00 pm  Sat: 2:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Wet Dog Cafe & Astoria Brewing Company
description: The Wet Dog Café was founded in 1995. The Brewery was added in 1997 under the name Pacific Rim Brewery. The name of the Brewery was changed to Astoria Brewing Co. in 2005 to commemorate Astoria’s First Brewing Company which was established in 1872. The Wet Dog was named after….the original owners dog…he loved the water and was always WET.    Our Brew Master uses only the finest ingredients to create our exceptional beers. Each beer is handcrafted using a wide range of hops & grains, thus creating unique flavors. It takes approximately 2 weeks for grain, water & hops to become our tasty brews. Our brewery has a 4 barrel system & in 2008 we added two 8 barrel fermenting tanks allowing us to produce over 800 barrels annually.

name: Wet Head Brewery
description: Born from a friendship and chance to drink on the job, Billy Jack and Loren started a journey to make beer for themselves.  What grew out of that was the opportunity to create  something for others.  We quickly realized that our experiments needed to be captured and recreated due to popular demand.  This created a year long journey to acquire the needed  regulatory approval.  In January of 2013, it all became official and we were able to open to the public.  Our dream has shifted a few times but the desire to create something loved and consumed by many hasn't changed.  It has been a wonderful and stressful journey so far and we can't wait to see where it takes us next.
hoursOfOperation: Fri:  5:00pm - 9:00pm Sat:  4:00pm - 9:00pm  Other days upon request.

name: Weyerbacher Brewing Company
description: Established in 1995, Weyerbacher Brewing Company, Inc. was founded in the historic city of Easton, Pennsylvania. We bring artistry, mischief and adventure to the world of brewing so every Weyerbacher beer is an incredible experience.    We, the brewers of Weyerbacher, are continually pushing the envelope of taste experiences, obliterating style guidelines and having a blast while we're at it! Cheers!

name: Whaler's Brewing Company
description: Bringing locally produced beer (by locally produced people) to Wakefield, RI.

name: Smithfiled
description: Brewpub located in Smithfield, VA. Opening fall of 2014.

name: Whetstone Station Restaurant and Brewery
description: Beautiful views, great food and beer in a fun atmosphere on the water. Brattleboro waterfront restaurant. Roof deck and Bier Garten now open! Full restaurant opening soon!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu:	11:30 am - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat:	11:30 am - 11:00 pm  Sun:	11:30 am - 10:00 pm

name: Whistler Brewing Company
description: Located in Whistler, British Columbia this brewery has a solid rotation of beers consisting of :  Black Tusk Ale, Whiskey Jack Ale, Bear Paw Honey Lager, Powder Mountain Lager and Lost Lake IPA. As well as frequent seasonal offerings.

name: White Birch Brewing
description: Founded in 2009, White Birch Brewing has been consistently dedicated to the creation of thoughtful, heartfelt ales for the fun loving beer drinker. Providing beers that range from historical, to contemporary, to the avant-garde, each batch of beer is carefully brewed by hand, and left unfiltered for an exceptional depth of flavor.
hoursOfOperation: Winter 2014 Hours:  Friday: 12 noon to 6 p.m.  Saturday: 12 noon to 4 p.m.  Sunday – Thursday: CLOSED

name: White Bluffs Brewing
description: Opening November 2010 in Richland, WA, White Bluffs Brewing has been creating great brews since day one. You're thinking, "Well, of course they would say that about themselves"! Don't take our word for it, come and in taste what our fans are talking about or read what they're recommending on Yelp!    Our love of beer, quality ingredients, and 25+ years of experience gives us more than one reason to serve Richland, Kennewick, Pasco and the Northwest with great beer.    Stop in and say hi, we'd love to give you a tour and hang out while you enjoy our humble brewery!    We say "we brew beer with character for people with taste,"  Check us out and find out why.
hoursOfOperation: Tu-Th: 4:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Fri: 4:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: White Flame Brewing Company
hoursOfOperation: Tuesday - Thursday: 4-10ish  Friday & Saturday: 4-12ish

name: White Lion Brewing Company
description: White Lion symbolizes grace with limitless boundaries, the consumer being part of something bigger than them; positioned between lessons taught and possibilities inspired by their energy and spirit.

name: White Pony microbrewery
description: White Pony is a micro-brewery located in Padova (Italy). We brew our beers in Belgium and Italy. All our Beers are handmade, unfiltered & unpasteurized

name: White Rabbit Brewing Company
hoursOfOperation: Fri - Sat: 6:00 pm - 11:00 pm

name: White River Brewing
description: As a small batch brewery, White River Brewing Company specializes in traditional European beers, particularly styles from Belgium, Britain, and Germany, all with an American twist. With uncompromising quality, at White River Brewing Company we work hard to make each flavorful, complex sip, a special occasion. With every batch we use only the finest ingredients available, individually chosen to add layers and complexity to each of our products.     Quality Craft BeerDesigned to appeal to the weekend warrior and discerning enthusiast in all of us, our four staple offerings and seasonal rotating beers are adding steam to the craft beer revolution in Southwest Missouri, and delivering a unique experience in every bottle.

name: White Street Brewing Company
description: White Street Brewing Co., proud to be located in historic downtown Wake Forest, is a small, locally owned independent manufacturer of craft beer. You can enjoy White Street's flavorful handcrafted ales and lagers in restaurants and bars throughout the Triangle and beyond. Or sit down in our taproom where you can see the entire brewing operation and let us pour you some brewed-on-the-premises goodness.    While snacks are available in our taproom, we are not a restaurant. Our focus is brewing beer and we're not only passionate about it, but we're darn good at it, too. From tours and t-shirts to dart leagues and other special events, you will discover Something's Brewing on White Street.
hoursOfOperation: Monday-Thursday, 4pm - 10pm  Friday 4pm - 10pm  Saturday 12pm - 12am  Sunday 12pm - 10pm

name: Whitehorse Brewing LLC
description: Whitehorse Brewing is located in Berlin Pennsylvania a few blocks from mainstreets lower diamond. The brewery is located on the edge of the farms that surround Brothersvalley and Somerset county. Our name comes from "Whitehorse Mountain" located right outside of Berlin, where we hunt, play and live.  Whitehorse beers are all natural and made from water, yeast, barley and hops. Some of our seasonal beers will feature natural flavors like brothers valley real maple sugar from our maple trees, and other natural local flavors.    We brew beer here because, well we love it and local is how we have always lived. To us Whitehorse isn't part of a new "slow food movement" it is just our way of life. We pride ourselves in using as much local product as possible and maintaining our natural rural roots in creating the beers we know you will love.    At Whitehorse we believe being environmentally concious and sustainable is important. For example our grains are recycled by giving them to a local farmer who uses it for feed for his livestock which causes no waste into the local environment.    We work to ensure our recipes and products are something we love but also you absolutely enjoy and will also appreciate the perfection we put into them. Please enjoy our beers as much as we enjoy creating them.
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Fri: 5:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat: 9:00 am - 5:00 pm

name: Wichita Brewing Company
description: Wichita Brewing Company offers a welcoming neighborhood brewpub experience, including 9 flat screen televisions to watch your favorite games, friendly staff, and great entertainment. We are local beer enthusiasts, and we have carefully hand-crafted a variety of unique beers for your enjoyment. We also have an exciting menu of appetizers, pizzas and sandwiches, all baked in our wood-fired pizza oven. So, stop in for lunch with your co-workers, bring the family for dinner, or meet your friends for a few brews after work. We're waiting for you!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu:	11:00 am - 12:00 am  Fri - Sat:	11:00 am - 2:00 am  Sun:	11:00 am - 12:00 am

name: Wicked Beaver Brewing Company
description: Wicked Beaver is a West Texas Craft Brewery, formed in Spring of 2009. We are a hands-on Brewery, with no automation to speak of, this keeps us in touch with every batch of beer we brew.  	  On an old dirt road, far from the beaten path, deep in the midst of no-where lives a Wicked Beaver. Why is he Wicked, you may ask? He is Wicked from the ways of the world, so many demands, too many deadlines, minor appreciation, and never enough time. So with little more than the stick in his hand and the Hops in his hanker chief, he journeyed West. Upon arriving in the West he hopped from the tailgate, choked on the dust, and kicked a tumble weed rolling his direction. This is the West, the place full of opportunity “he asked himself” and sighed but after a few Wicked Cold months, the landscape began to change, grass became lush green, trees bloomed and the flowers opened. The Wicked Beaver found the warm days, and cool nights were perfect to pursue his passion.    The Wicked Beaver and his brewing partners have been Brewing Craft Specialty Beer’s in secret for years, perfecting the fragrant aroma by blending only best hops and hand selecting the Malted Barley for the most unique varieties of flavors and textures. The Wicked Beaver is ready to share his unique creations with you!

name: Wicked Weed Brewing Company
description: In 2009 Walt and Luke sat at a craft beer bar and talked about the dream of opening their own brewery that would focus on big West Coast hoppy ales and authentic Belgain ales that would inspire those who drank them. From that conversation forward there would be no looking back. A business plan was developed and hundreds of test batches brewed. In 2011 Walt and Luke’s lifelong friend Ryan Guthy and his parents Rick and Denise all sat down at their house in the mountains of Western North Carolina to taste some of Luke and Walt’s creations while looking over the plans for what would be Wicked Weed Brewing.  After being thoroughly impressed with the full flavor and vision of the project, the Guthys joined the Dickinsons and the team was assembled.  Over the next months Wicked Weed Brewing found a home at 91 Biltmore avenue, a building that seemed destined to be a brewery.  With the creativity of Luke, vision of Walt, dedication of Ryan, exquisite taste of Denise and wisdom of Rick a truly unique brewery was born.  So from the humble beginning of a basement, the dream of Wicked Weed Brewing has come to life. Our beer is bold, full of excitement and flavor.  Always focused on drinkability and pushing the boundaries of what we think we are capable of.  Wicked Weed Brewing will always evolve, always grow and always aspire to be greater.  Join us in bringing something a little Wicked to Asheville.

name: Wicks Brewing Co
description: Wicks Brewing Company is not your typical Brewery. Besides brewing up barrels of delicious Craft Beer and having a full tasting bar, we offer our guests other amenities as well.     If you are an avid homebrewer or wish to jump into the hobby of homebrewing, we carry everything you need to brew your own Craft Beer or Soft Drinks at home...yes, Soft Drinks as well. There’s no tastier Root Beer than one you made yourself.     If you would like to brew your own Craft Beer or Soft Drinks, but don’t have the room to do it at home or just plain don’t want to own the tools & equipment, we have that covered as well. We have six separate stations where you can brew your own Craft Beer or Soft Drink right here at Wicks Brewing. This system is known as a Brew on Premise (or BOP). All you need to do is choose one of our recipes you would like to try and we will walk you thru the whole brewing process using one of our BOP stations and the ingredients from our stock.    Hungry?...Well, we can take care of that as well. We have an onsite, fully stocked kitchen. The delicious choices on our menu range from appetizers to salads to hardy meals and even desserts.     Make Wicks Brewing your next destination for fun & relaxation, you’ll be happy you did.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Wed: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm  Thu - Sat: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm  Sun: 11:00 am - 6:00 pm

name: Widmer Brothers Brewing
description: Widmer Brothers Brewing is located in beautiful and brew-friendly Portland, OR. Our publicly-held brewery employs over 150 people who are as passionate about quality craft beer as Kurt & Rob themselves.    We opened the brewery in 1984, and built a new 40-barrel brewing system in our current Russell Street location in 1990. We've grown steadily ever since. In 1996, we completed installation of a state-of-the art 250-barrel brewhouse, bringing our capacity to 220,000 barrels per year. In 1996, for the first time in our brewery’s history we also installed a bottling line, capable of producing 500 bottles per minute. In 2008 we added six new 1500-barrel fermentation tanks that increased our capacity to 450,000 barrels per year, and added a new keg filling line capable of filling 300 kegs per hour.

name: Wiens Brewing Company
description: Wiens Brewing Company is a new Temecula brewery! We were happy to open our doors on November 10th, 2012. You may ask if we are affiliated with the winery in Temecula, Wiens Family Cellars, and the answer is yes. The Wiens family has come together yet again in the community of Temecula to open another fun destination. Along with making wine, the Wiens family has been brewing beer for nearly 17 years. At Wiens Brewing Company you can enjoy tastings of beer, pints, or even have a half-gallon-growler filled to enjoy at home. This Temecula brewery tasting room is very spacious with open areas to see the brewhouse and all of our shiny tanks. Come down and try some of our latest beers while we are open Monday through Thursday from 3pm to 8pm, Friday from 1pm to 8pm, or join us on the weekends from noon to 8pm. Spend a day in Temecula and enjoy Temecula's newest brewery, Wiens Brewing Company.
hoursOfOperation: Hours: M-Th: 3-8, F: 1-8  Weekends: 12-8

name: Wig & Pen Tavern & Brewery
description: The Wig and Pen Tavern and Brewery is a Canberra institution for those who appreciate the value of a truly good beer or cider. Opened by Lachlan McOmish in 1994 and still going strong- the pub moves from strength to strength with its delicious beer and warm, friendly atmosphere. The bar features local wines, an excellent selection of spirits as well as 15 beers and 1 cider, which are all masterfully brewed by the brilliant and award winning Richard Watkins. As an added bonus, 4 of our beers are traditional real ales which means they are cask conditioned and hand-pumped (a rare find in Australia!) The kitchen also serves up some excellent English pub food including burgers, bangers and mash, cheese platters and curries.    So come along and enjoy all that we can offer because, in the words of Lachlan McOmish, "Life is too short not to enjoy the finest quality beers."
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Tue: 11:30 am - 10:00 pm  Wed - Thu: 11:30 am - 11:00 pm  Fri: 11:30 am - 12:00 am  Sat: 2:00 pm - 12:00 am  Sun: 2:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Wild Earth Brewing
description: One of Washington's new artisanal breweries, Wild Earth Brewing handcrafts its products in the foothills of the Cascade Mountains. Brewed in small batches for our onsite taproom and limited distribution of kegs and bottles around the area. We aim to continually challenge ourselves through unique production methods and ingredients to bring our customers the best beer possible. Stop by our taproom for the latest bottle offerings, growler fills, or to enjoy a fresh pint of our latest batch.
hoursOfOperation: Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm  Sun: 11:00 am - 8:00 pm

name: Wild Goose Brewery, LLC
description: Wild Goose Brewery was purchased by Flying Dog Brewing Company.

name: Wild Heaven Craft Beers
description: Wild Heaven is a Georgia company created by lifelong Georgians - founder Nick Purdy (also Publisher of Paste Magazine) with beer recipes designed by Trappeze Pub owner Eric Johnson. Our core year-round portfolio is focused on world-class beers designed to offer something new to the beer landscape—not simply creating our version of what everyone else is doing.

name: Wild Onion Brewing
description: Handcrafted Lagers & Ales, Brewed on Site! Available by the Pint, Growler, Can, or Keg!
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Thu: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 12:00 am  Sun: 11:00 am - 8:00 pm

name: Wild Rose Brewery
description: Wild Rose Brewery, located in Calgary, Alberta, Canada, is a craft brewery that produces bottled beers and draught ales available to beer lovers in pubs, restaurants and liquor outlets all across Alberta.    All Wild Rose beers are unpasteurized and preservative-free. That's not because we are lazy; rather, it's a conscious choice to offer beer lovers the best products available in Canada. That quality is reflected in our six bottled beers and our draught-only classic ales.

name: Wild Wolf Brewing Co
description: Currently a homebrew shop and nano - brewery serving growlers of beer and rootbeer. We offer homebrew demonstrations every saturday at noon!     Look for our Pub coming later this fall

name: Wild Woods Brewery
description: Wild Woods is a microbrewery in Boulder, Colorado that creates handcrafted beers inspired by the outdoors. Our beers begin with recognizable styles and are brewed to highlight elements of the wilderness.
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Fri: 4:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat: 2:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Wildcard Brewing Company
description: Wildcard Brewing Company was just a dream until experience, encouragement and circumstance made it a reality. The idea behind the name Wildcard is to pursue the unknown. Wildcard Brewing Company’s owners left stability for chaos, moved to England to learn the craft of beer making, and started a business in an uncertain economy, all in pursuit of a dream. You’d call them crazy, adventurous, unpredictable....a wildcard. Our story is one of the unexpected; a place where there are no limits, where perseverance and a free spirit will turn dreams into reality.     It started when Jeff and Jenny brewed two beers to give away as wedding favors at a brewery in San Luis Obispo where they went to college. Homebrew projects and burst bottle explosions ensued in the years after. But a casual passion soon turned career as Jeff and Jenny headed to England. Jeff studied brewing science at the University of Sunderland and Jenny conducted “research” in various local pubs. Once back in the states Jeff headed straight for the most competitive brewing location, the Pacific Northwest. Now 4 years later the pair are back in Jeff’s hometown of Redding building out their production brewery.    Wildcard is small startup business focused on brewing flavorful beers and enriching the communities that enjoy them. Spending dollars locally is just a part of that commitment. We will source products and services within 500 miles of our facility as much as possible and intend to exclusively sell beers within that same area. Supporting local businesses not only has great economic impacts but environmental as well. We don’t want to just do business in the Redding community we want to be a part of it. It is important to give back as much as possible to the community and we will make it a point to donate and get involved in local causes and efforts.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Thu: 2:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 5:00 pm

name: Williamsburg AleWerks
description: Williamsburg AleWerks is located in the heart of the early colonies in Williamsburg, Virginia. Established in 2006 we have rolled out a broad range of beer offerings and quickly established a reputation for fine beer. We operate a direct fired brick-clad Peter Austin brew house and ferment all our beers in state-of-the-art conical fermentors.

name: Willimantic Brewing Company
description: Our original Main Street Café was founded in 1991, and began operations as a small deli in the old Capitol Theatre building on Main Street in Willimantic, CT. Occupying both the lobby and concession area of the theatre, seating was limited to 50 people. After 3 years we were bursting at the seams and made the move to 877 Main Street, another historic building. There we expanded to a full service restaurant and featured American craft-brewed beers and an extensive menu.

name: Wind River Brewing Company
description: Wind River Brewing Company is located at the base of the Wind River Mountains in downtown Pinedale, Wyoming. Our brewery is the spot for those who appreciate the art of handcrafted superior brews with a wide range of flavors and notes. We brew award winning beers, created in-house using only the finest ingredients and pure glacier water.    "We are known for having legendary beer and the best food in town." If you're looking for a quick bite to eat or want to relax and sample our entire selection of beer we welcome you to join us at Wind River Brewing Co.
hoursOfOperation: Sunday - Thursday: 11 a.m. - 11 p.m.  Friday & Saturday: 11 a.m. - Midnight

name: Windswept Brewing Co
description: Beautiful beaches, a great climate, superb golf courses, fishing, nearby mountains and the world's best whisky, the Moray Coast is a great place to live. Now, Windswept Brewing Co Ltd have added award winning local ales to the list of Moray's attractions.

name: Main Cidery
description: We are the first, and only, licensed and bonded cidery in the Piedmont of the Carolinas.  We produce various types of Award Winning Hand-Crafted Hard Ciders with a commitment to sustainable agricultural practices.     As an extension of Windy Hill Orchard and Cidery, we are family owned and operated and located in York, SC.     Please be sure to visit our facebook page and our orchard website for details about upcoming events, product news, and hours and directions.
hoursOfOperation: Tuesday through Saturday: 9:00 a.m. till 5:00 p.m.  Select Sundays*: Noon till 5:00 p.m.

name: Winery Exchange
description: Winery Exchange was founded in 1999 and is headquartered in Novato, California, USA. The company maintains regional sales offices around the United States and international offices in the United Kingdom and Spain.    Winery Exchange is the only full-service, corporate brand, beverage alcohol company that sources beer, wine and spirits from the finest regions worldwide. The company was founded with the intent of blending extensive industry expertise with cutting-edge business practices. The result is a dynamic, fast-growing company poised to take advantage of new trends in the beverage alcohol industry.

name: Wingman Brewers
description: Inspired by Tacoma's legacy of honest hard work, Wingman Brewers strives to create a strong selection of spirited, full-flavored beers for the South Sound region.
hoursOfOperation: Taproom Hours:  2pm-11pm Thursday, Friday, Saturday

name: Wisconsin Brewing Company
description: he Wisconsin Brewing Company brewhouse we're building is an exciting mixture of old world, artisan craftsmanship and state-of-the art brewing technology. Built in Hudson, WI, our German-engineered Huppmann Brewhouse will be capable of producing in excess of 100,000 barrels of Wisconsin craft beer annually. The tradition and history behind Huppmann goes back more than 130 years—perfect for true craft beer.    In addition to a great brew house, we have a one-barrel Pilot Brewery on site to develop many of our beers, as well as an event center for parties and other events. The event center also has a gift shop, where you can buy Wisconsin Brewing Company apparel, gift items, and of course, beer.    Put all these pieces together next to a scenic pond with access to bike trails and plenty of beautiful landscape and you can have one heck of a brewery experience.

hoursOfOperation: Monday CLOSED  Tues-Fri 3-9pm Tours 4, 5 & 6pm  Sat 10am-9pm Tours 10am-4pm every hour  Sun 10am-5pm Tours 10am-4pm

Brewmaster Jamie Baertsch is feverishly working on seasonal flavors as well. These brews can be enjoyed at any of the three bars located within the brewpub.

name: Wiseacre Brewery and Taproom
description: WISEACRE is a craft brewery committed to top quality, uniquely flavorful beer that appeals to passionate & progressive people through education & good times.  The brewery name comes from a term of endearment/scolding their grandmother used on the young troublemakers.  Brothers Davin & Kellan Bartosch dreamed up WISEACRE many moons ago & have been on an extensive quest procuring top-notch experience from around the globe to deliver the crunkest brewery possible in their groovy hometown of Memphis, TN.

name: Wolaver's Fine Organic Ales
description: Our brewery is dedicated to brewing great tasting beers, supporting sustainable agriculture, and minimizing our impact on the environment.    100% Organic Hops and Malts

name: Wolf Creek Restaurant and Brewery
description: Wolf Creek Brewery was founded as a brewpub in 1997 as "Wolf Creek Restaurant & Brewing Co." by Rob and Laina McFerren.  Brewer, Rob, has won many awards for his varied beer styles, including "Howlin' Hefeweizen" (Bavarian Hef) and "Midnight Howl" and India Black Ale.  In 2013, they expanded brewery operations and built a production facility in the Mann-Biomedical Park in Valencia.  June 2nd, 2014 marks the date of their first bottling run.  Cheers!

name: Wolf Hills Brewing Co
description: WOLF HILLS BREWING CO is a craft brewery located in historic Abingdon, Virginia. The brewery takes its name from the original appellation that Daniel Boone gave to the wilderness that became Abingdon. Tradition holds that Boone and his hunting companion spent a sleepless night along a hill on the Great Road after their dogs encountered a pack of wolves, which had a den in a nearby cave. Drawing from this rich history, Wolf Hills Brewing CO melds together time honored brewing methods using only the highest quality ingredients with modern beer styles inspired by the wide array of fragrant hops from the Pacific-Northwest. Wolf Hills brews in small batches that are only distributed in the Virginia Highlands. The result is a level of fresh, savory beer that is unmatched in this region. Discover one of our many styles for yourself . . . you’ll be howling for more.
hoursOfOperation: Check Website for Changing Growler Hours

name: Main Location
description: Wolfe Brewing Company has just opened in Pagosa Springs Colorado. Hand-crafted micro beers brewed on-site. Full menu available as well. Open 11am daily.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:00 am - 2:00 am

name: Wolverine State Brewing Company
description: We are the proud brewers of Michigan's Most Drinkable Beers. We are the only microbrewery in Michigan that specializes in making lagers for everyone. What does this mean? It means that from light to dark, every beer we brew is designed to be a beer you can love.

name: Wonderland Brewing Company
description: Wonderland Brewing Company is a new small batch brewery in Broomfield, Colorado, and our goal is to turn every frown upside down. Big dreams, a big property, and carefully crafted beers are our not-so-secret ingredients to do so. With 9,000-square-feet of space, 94 parking spots, and over an acre of outdoor fun, Wonderland Brewing Company offers a unique craft beer experience to beer-buffs of all sorts.    How can you get a unique craft beer experience at our brewery, you wonder? Hold a ping pong match on one of our six tournament-style ping pong tables that adorn our tasting room, burn those hard earned beer calories al fresco on our basketball courts, or simply take a seat in one of the largest tasting rooms around and enjoy a quality, hand-crafted brew. Thanks to our shocking space that's ideal for corporate outings, private parties, farmers markets, classic car shows, yoga classes, and more, Wonderland Brewing Company is an oasis for the community and beyond.    Enough bragging about our property, though. Wanna know why we chose to dive into the brewing industry?    Our passion for people, happiness, and the magic behind making beer inspires our team to bring the community together to celebrate life and cherish the ritual of beer. We truly treasure craft beer's gift of rallying friends and family, and we are excited for the opportunity to bring joy to beer-fanatics. Our head brewer values the art and science of brewing beer and has a philosophy entrenched in care for his creations, which will be discovered during every sip of our quality brews.    When you visit Wonderland, you'll find a creative crew that is committed to making you smile.    Please know that standards are set high for Wonderland Brewing Company in all aspects of our brewery.

name: Wooden Legs Brewing Company
description: The Wooden Legs Brewing Company name is tongue in cheek homage to Judge Wilmot Wood Brookings. Judge Brookings is a significant figure in history of South Dakota. The county and city were named after him although he only visited the city twice.    In February 1858, Brookings rode a horse from Sioux Falls to the Yankton area during a blizzard. His horse slipped and fell into Split Rock Creek in the freezing weather. Brookings made it safely to Yankton, but his wet legs had suffered such severe frostbite they both needed to be amputated. He spent the rest of his life using a pair of squeaky, wooden legs.

name: Wooden Robot Brewery
description: Wooden Robot is a new urban farmhouse craft brewery that will be located in Charlotte, NC!

name: Woodfour Brewing Company
description: A contemporary artisan brewery focused on a unique beer experience. Located in the heart of Sonoma County. Opening Spring 2013...

name: Woodland Empire Ale Craft
description: Imaginative brew creations concocted by husband and wife team Rob and Keely Landerman, Dusty Schmidt, and Tom Dolan.  Handcrafted. Imaginative. Idahoan.
hoursOfOperation: Tasting Room hours:   Tues- Thurs: 3 pm- 10 pm  Fri: 3 pm-11 pm  Sat: 12 noon-11 pm  Sun: 12 noon-8 pm

name: Woodman Brewery
description: Custom Brewing Services and Brewpub at the Whistle Stop
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 9:00 am - 10:00 pm

name: Downtown Grill & Brewery
description: The Downtown Grill & Brewery is a nice brewpub downtown with patio seating on Gay Street as well as a back porch. The atmosphere is lodge-like with rich wood and copper brewing equipment. There is also a private room you can rent upstairs.

name: Woods Polk Station
description: Adventurous beer for curious drinkers. Brewed fresh in San Francisco and Oakland, CA.

name: Woodstock Inn Station & Brewery
description: The Woodstock Inn opened in 1982.    The Woodstock Inn Brewery began brewing beer in 1995 on a 7 barrel system. We started as a Brew Pub with 8 different beers. As demand for our beers grew we added a 30 barrel production facility in 2012. We have two breweries on our property. The seven barrel brewery brews for our restaurant and does limited releases. The 30 barrel does all of our production and bottling. We do Brewery Tours every day at noon, seven days a week. There is a $5.00 charge, a pint glass a tasting is included. We also have a cask ale always on in the Brew Pub.       The Brewery is open for breakfast, lunch and dinner, 7 days a week. We also have 33 well appointed guest rooms, we also have a function room for 165 for weddings and gatherings.  Please stop by for a visit.
hoursOfOperation: Open 11:30am-10pm Daily   Please call ahead for offseason hours

name: Woodward Avenue Brewers
description: Woodward Avenue Brewers, or “WAB”, as we're affectionately called, is much more than a restaurant or bar. Established in 1997, The WAB has become a landmark along Woodward Avenue in Ferndale and has welcomed visitors – those in the neighborhood and those far and wide – for more than 16 years. Pioneers of the craft brew scene, WAB is the go-to gathering place for patrons to enjoy handcrafted brews, great food, friendly atmosphere and the action on historic Woodward Avenue.

name: Wop's Hops Brewing Company
description: Wop's Hops Brewing Co. is Sanford, Florida's first microbrewery. Come sample our fine Ales in our tasting room and beer garden. Dog friendly.
hoursOfOperation: Thurs,Fri and Sat 4pm Till Closing

name: Working Man Brewing Company
description: Working Man Brewing is Livermore’s newest brewery, located at 5542 Brisa Street, just off of Vasco Road.  Getting the brewery up and running has been a labor of love for the owners, taking the better part of 18 months to turn the space into a full production brewery.  We are excited to finally bring our love of beer and commitment to quality to Livermore, the Tri-Valley, and beyond.    Our story is one of two independent breweries, Mt. Diablo Brewing and Working Man Brewing Company, coming together to work on one common goal.  Both companies were founded by award-winning home brewers who have a passion to bring high quality, well crafted beer that is fresh and local.  A chance meeting brought these working men together; a shared vision now combines forces under one name, Working Man Brewing Company.    The company’s brewers have each have spent years working to perfect great beer recipes.  Beer geeks at heart, both will tinker and tweak the ingredients until the product is just right.  The main goal always being to make a beer they could be proud to share and proud to drink. We never let a beer go out the door that we don’t believe in.
hoursOfOperation: Friday 4-7PM  Saturday 12-6PM  Sunday 12-4PM

name: Wormtown Brewery
description: Worcester's only brewery.  Winner of numerous awards including the 2014 US Open Grand National Champion.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 12:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Worth Brewing Company
description: Backed by the support of countless friends and neighbors, Worth Brewing Company opened on March 17, 2007. Its owners, the husband-and-wife team of Peter Ausenhus and Margaret Bishop, have lived near Northwood since their purchase of a nearby farmhouse and acreage in 1998. Nebraska natives, Peter and Margaret lived and worked in Minneapolis for many years before moving to Worth County, where Peter’s grandparents had lived and farmed and where Peter had spent much time as a boy.     Having already established Margaret’s engineering business in downtown Northwood, the couple turned next to Peter’s passion – brewing great beer. For 24 years, Peter has brewed award-winning beer, winning contests, teaching others and perfecting classic recipes along the way. He’s a BJCP National Beer Judge, has brewed professionally with Summit Brewing Company of St. Paul, Minn., and worked on staff at one of the country’s most popular brewing supply shops.    Worth Brewing Company is Peter and Margaret’s way of helping to reintroduce a great tradition – the locally owned brewery serving hand-crafted, high-quality, distinctive beers for the enjoyment of locals and lucky visitors. The nation’s small and mid-sized towns were once dotted with such breweries. Today, Worth Brewing – perhaps one of the world’s smallest craft brewers – brings a bit of those days back to delight the growing number of those who appreciate fine, locally brewed beers.
hoursOfOperation: Tap Room Hours:   Wed: 5 to 9 p.m.  Fri: 5 to 11 p.m.  Sat: noon to 11 p.m.

name: Worthy Brewing
description: Worthy Brewing is going big.  We hit the ground running as a production brewery with the capacity to brew 60,000 barrels from the get go.  With about 22,000 square feet of  floor space and an average ceiling height of 35 feet, we’ll have plenty of room to grow in.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm  Sun: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm

name: Wrecking Bar Brewpub
description: The most exciting new brewpub in Atlanta! A cornerstone of both Little Five Points and Inman Park at the corner of Moreland and Austin Ave. Brewpub on lower level facing Austin.

name: Wyder's Cider Company
description: Wyder's® Cider was formulated in 1987 by cider master Ian Wyder who learned his craft in England at one of the UK's premier ciderys.    Wyder's Cider was first sold in Vancouver, Canada and was later introduced into the US market in Washington and Oregon. Northern California's Bay Area got a taste in 1993 and Wyder's Cider is now widely available throughout the Western US.

name: Wylam Brewery
description: A well established successful brewery in Northumberland, UK.
hoursOfOperation: Monday	9:00 am – 4:00 pm  Tuesday	9:00 am – 4:00 pm  Wednesday	9:00 am – 4:00 pm  Thursday	9:00 am – 4:00 pm  Friday	9:00 am – 3:00 pm  Saturday	Closed  Sunday	Closed

name: Wynkoop Brewing Company
description: Colorado’s first brewpub, Wynkoop Brewing Company was founded in 1988 by a group of young entrepreneurs and urban pioneers led by current Denver Governor John Hickenlooper.    Our brewpub’s hallmarks -- highly acclaimed small-batch beers, high quality food & service, the city’s best pool hall and our glorious 1888 building -- helped make us a major catalyst for the revival of Lower Downtown Denver.    Today Wynkoop Brewing Company is a beer-blessed Denver institution, a must-visit Colorado landmark and one of the nation’s most revered craft breweries.    We’re also one of the city’s best places for private and corporate events. We’ve hosted everything from Democratic National Convention parties to beer festivals, weddings and company conferences. (All with great beer and food.)    Today we’re expanding our downtown brewing efforts to deliver more of our ambitious, artisan-style craft beer to Denver’s best beer outlets. Look for cans of our beer in local stores and kegs of all of our beers at the area’s top bars and restaurants.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:00 am - 2:00 am

name: Wynwood Brewing Company
description: Wynwood Brewing Company is Miami’s first craft production brewery in the heart of Wynwood Art District, featuring a tap room. We are family owned and operated with the simple objective of bringing fresh, delicious, and creative beers to thirsty South Floridians and tourists alike. We operate a 15-barrel brewhouse and distribute our blond ale, IPA, Porter, barrel aged Strong Ales and seasonal offerings.

name: WYOld West Brewing Company
description: WYOld West Brewing Company features goods from Wyoming's sun-kissed harvest. Located in the heart of downtown Powell, Wyoming.

name: Wyoming State Brewing Company
description: The World Famous Wonder Bar is home to the Wyoming State Brewing Company, Casper’s only premium microbrewery.    Brewmaster Ty Martinez handcrafts brews from the finest ingredients and leaves the beer unfiltered, resulting in nothing but pure, bold flavors. Our taps rotate constantly, so you always have something new to try.    Over the past few years, we have grown, but we’re still a small-town business with a few local employees who are as passionate about their beer as they are about the Wyoming lifestyle. They work hard  and are dedicated to the unofficial drink of our great state.    Craving an amazing small-batch beer? We make over 15 styles of beer—from Big Horn Black Ale with toasted malt to Oil City IPA, and Grandma Betty’s Pale Ale made with apricots—and we hope you enjoy them as much as we do.    Take home a fresh Wyoming State Brewing Company growler from our huge selection. Our brew flavors rotate regularly, so be sure to check out our Facebook page or website for the daily picks. And don’t forget your punch card. Fill 9 and get the 10th free.

name: XII Tribes Brewing Company
description: Dedicated to quality craft beer, & creating a culture of integrity for the everyday go-getter. Experience the weekend everyday. High Point, NC. 2015.

name: Yak & Yeti Brewpub
description: The Yak and Yeti Brewpub is located in Olde Town Arvada and resides in an 1864 haunted Victorian brick mansion. Our 7 barrel brewhouse can be seen from the lobby near the bar.     All our beers are handcrafted by our brewmaster, Adam Draeger. Seasonals beers are released monthly and sometimes weekly. Stop by for pint of craft beer or take home a growler today.

hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sat: 11:00 am - 9:30 pm  Sun: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm

name: Yakima Craft Brewing Co.
description: Yakima Craft Brewing Co. is a craft beer brewery located in the heart of North America's leading producer of hops, the Yakima Valley in the state of Washington. We produce high-quality craft ales and lagers with an emphasis on full-bodied taste and unique character.     YCBC labels are available in the greater Yakima Valley and in many locations in the state of Washington (and occasionally, beyond).
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu:	4:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Fri:	3:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat:	1:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Yaletown Brewing
description: The Yaletown Brewing Company is Vancouver's original and best Brewpub. Founded in 1994, just as the former warehouse district of Yaletown was just beginning to emerge as a destination for businesses and residents, the YBC was built with the vision of being a true neighbourhood pub - a welcoming gathering place whether you arrived dressed in a suit or flip-flops.
hoursOfOperation: Sun - 11:30am - Midnight  Mon - 11:30am - Midnight  Tues - 11:30am - Midnight  Wed - 11:30am - Midnight  Thur - 11:30am - 1am  Fri - 11:30am - 3am  Sat - 11:30am - 3am

name: Yalobusha Brewing Company
description: Brewed In The Red Clay Hills Of North Mississippi
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sat: 9:00 am - 6:00 pm

name: Yard Owl Craft Brewery
description: YARD OWL ales are brewed in a traditional European style. Hand crafted exclusivly by James Walsh and Kristop Brown, YARD OWL brews will be available at fine pubs, bodegas, farm markets, and local stores in the summer of 2012, the dawn of wisdom (by the pint.)

name: Yards Brewing Company
description: In 1988, two cash-strapped collegiate wrestlers realized that they could sustain their thirst for quality beer without spending their modest savings at the local liquor store by brewing beer themselves. So began the friendship of Tom Kehoe and Jon Bovit.    As they made their way through college they continued to experiment with homebrewing and formulating new recipes. Proud of their product, they were eager to share it with friends. An instant favorite, it wasn't long until they realized their modest homebrewing operation wasn't going to be enough to satisfy the growing demand.    During the early 1990s, many breweries opened, and craft brewing started to gain popularity. Working in a small English-style brewery in Western Maryland, Tom Kehoe and Jon Bovit decided to take matters into their own hands, and in 1994, they founded Yards Brewing Company.
hoursOfOperation: Mon: 12:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Tues - Wed: 12:00 am - 7:00 pm  Thurs - Sat: 12:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 4:00 pm

name: Yazoo Brewing Company
description: Yazoo Brewing began as just a dream, stoked by years of homebrewing in the basement. Linus and Lila Hall moved to Nashville from Mississippi in 1996, with Linus going to work as a tire engineer for Bridgestone and Lila as a curator for the Parthenon. Trying to make tires more round proved to be less fulfilling than making great beer, so with the encouragement of Lila, Linus quit his job, got a business degree from Vanderbilt and a craft-brewing education through a course at the American Brewer's Guild, and did an internship under Garrett Oliver at Brooklyn Brewery. Linus found a used 10 bbl brewing system from a brewpub in Iowa that had gone out of business, and went to work restoring a corner of the old Marathon Motorworks building for their brewery. Yazoo Brewing opened for business in Oct 2003, and quickly gained an enthusiastic local following.
hoursOfOperation: Thu:  4:00pm - 8:00pm Fri:  4:00pm - 8:00pm Sat:  2:00pm - 8:00pm Wed:  4:00pm - 6:00pm  Wednesday are Growler fills only

name: Yellow House Canyon Brew Works
description: YHCBW is a production brewery, sitting on the edge of our namesake, bringing craft brewing to the plains in an exciting way. Saddle up and help us bring this new ride to West Texas. Drink deeply and enjoy!

name: Yellow Springs Brewery
description: Yellow Springs Brewery is about creating more than just great tasting beer. We’re about Crafting Truth To Power. It’s a pretty simple concept, one that holds within it the purpose of self-expression and the promise of a stronger community.
hoursOfOperation: Wednesday through Friday 3-10pm  Saturday 1-10pm  Sunday 1-6pm

name: Yellow Truck Brewing Company
description: Yellow Truck Brewing Company's owners, Ross and Amanda Franklin, aspire to have their brewery be among Asheville's great craft breweries!

name: Yellowhammer Brewery
description: Launched in late 2010 in downtown Huntsville, Yellowhammer Brewing seeks to bring Belgian and German tradition to Alabama. That means Euopean styles, but with a slight Southern interpretation.  Thanks to Free the Hops and the change in Alabama's formerly restrictive beer laws, creativity in brewing has come to Alabama.    At Yellowhammer, head brewer Keith Yager draws inspiration from both Belgian and German brewing traditions. An accomplished home brewer since 1995, Yager has designed numerous seasonal and specialty batches, from the Dark Hammer Belgian Quad to the UberAlt sticke ale. Other recurring ales are more experimental, blending styles, as with Tobacco Road, an imperial amber designed to complement a good cigar, or the occasional Lonesome Hop series, which spotlights the character of an individual hop. Yellowhammer is Yager's first commercial undertaking.    Yellowhammer Brewing opened on Oct. 16, 2010 with the best-selling Belgian white ale and the IPA. Other staples sold throughout the year include a German style altbier and the Miracle Worker, a potent Belgian tripel.

name: Yellowstone Valley Brewing Co.
description: The Yellowstone Valley Brewery is located near the historic downtown district of Billings, Montana. All our ales are hand brewed under the watchful eye of Chief Brewer, George Moncure, brewed by Caleb Lausch and Ryan Koga, and served to you by all of us with Tap Room manager Donnie Veltri.    All our fermenting tanks are computer temperature controlled to keep the yeast happy! All brews are monitored for the correct carbonation content, and then immediately bottled to ensure the freshest, best tasting beer possible!

name: Production Facility
description: Yes Face Beer: Real Ale made in Georgia. Available in Cask or Keg    Gypsy brewer Mark Broe will be creating his British-style session ale in cask and keg form while looking for a place in Georgia to relocate his 8-barrel cask ale system.  Available from your distributors: Leon Farmer, Atlanta Beverage, and Eagle Rock.

name: YesterYears Brewery
description: YesterYears Brewery makes Great Beer to make Great Friends while making Great Memories!!

name: Yo-Ho Brewing Company
description: YO-HO BREWING COMPANY was established in 1996, as a subsidiary of Hoshino Resort CO., a Japanese leading resort management company. Its establishment was soon after the removal of the law, which prohibited the production of craft beer in Japan. Until then, Japanese people didn’t have “beer culture”. Almost all beers in Japan were “Lager beer” and people rarely knew about “Ale beer”. We started brewing “Ale” with an aim of letting Japanese people know rich and various tastes of Ale.

name: Yonkers Brewing Co.
description: The Yonkers Brewing Co. is a family of beer lovers and business minded people who have created a great beer for a great city. We are committed to creating quality hand-crafted brew with character. We are dedicated to bringing styles to market that will thrill the senses - color, aroma, texture, flavor and even sound (yes, our beer talks to us).     Why Yonkers?    Yonkers is experiencing a rebirth; it is experiencing a renaissance of architecture, business, communities - a renaissance of renewal. The city has always been a hub of culture and innovation – from Otis Elevator to Bakelite to Ella Fitzgerld – a city rich in arts, entertainment, cuisine and libations. Yonkers is a hub to New York City and to the Hudson Valley. It offers top-notch shopping such a Ridge Hill, amazing gardens like Untemeyer Park, and not to mention some amazing restaurants like Zuppa, X20, Pinch at Empire City, Rory Dolan’s and more.     With a growing beer culture, an array of top notch restaurants and a rich history, Yonkers has all the components of a great beer city. Co-Founders John Rubbo and Nick Califano have planted the roots of the brewery here and are excited to be part of a long list of exciting things happening.

name: York Brewery
description: Established in 1996 within the historic city walls, York Brewery is both a working brewery and a major tourist attraction providing customers locally and around the country with the first traditionally brewed ales from within the walls of York for over 40 years.

name: Yorkholo Brewing Co.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thurs: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 2:00 am  Sun: 10:00 am - 9:00 pm

name: Yorkshire Dales Brewing Company
description: • Brewing a vast selection of contemporary real ales  • Stouts,Smoked Porters, Dunkels, Bocks, Pilsners 3 specials every month  • Bottled conditioned ales, brewed by us, bottled by us

name: Yorkshire Heart
description: The brewery was established in March 2011. The brew house is situated on site with the vineyard and winery.

name: Young Henrys Brewing Company
description: Young Henrys is situated in the heart of thriving Newtown surrounded by street art, creative industries and alternative culture. The state of the art, natural gas driven DME brewery produces ales, lagers and ciders of extraordinary quality. Along with the best quality ingredients sourced from Australia and around the world, the true source of flavour is experience, passion and the daring to do something a little different.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Fri:	8:00 am - 5:00 pm  Sat:	9:00 am - 12:00 pm

name: Young Master Ales
description: Young Master Ales was born out of a desire to brew distinctive, world-class, extremely fresh beers locally for Hong Kong. With this project, our goal is to revive craft brewing in Hong Kong and bring the local drinking experience up a notch.     Our beers are brewed fresh with the highest quality ingredients. We will constantly innovate and bring new styles to showcase the diversity in beer. In doing that, we will push the envelope and possibly even make you rethink your perceptions of beer. We insist on preserving everything that’s good and natural about freshly brewed beer. To this end, we do not filter, pasteurize, or add artificial stabilizers or chemicals to our products simply to extend their shelf-life. We also use naturally produced carbon dioxide during fermentation and do not artificially carbonate. Our beer will be the freshest you can find in Hong Kong with the shortest distance traveled from grain to your glass.
streetAddress: Oceanic Industrial Centre, 2 Lee Lok Street

name: Yukon Brewing
description: Yukon Brewing opened its doors in 1997 under the name Chilkoot Brewing Co. Ltd. Owners Alan and Bob conceived their idea like many Yukon babies – around a campfire on a canoe trip. Both Ontario natives, they’ve lived and worked in the Territory for a good deal of their adult lives.    From that inaugural conversation grew plans for a craft brewery that would service the north with quality beer while keeping jobs and money in the territory.    Over a decade later Yukon Brewing, as it is called today, continues to work towards that goal. Employing a dozen or so staff (more in the busy summer months), Yukon Brewing actively supports countless Yukon events and causes each year.    Bob and Alan continue as owners and chief operators, growing the company outside the Yukon. The breweries 8 packaged beers are available across Alberta and BC with some even finding their way as far east as Quebec and at the Hannover Zoo in Germany.
hoursOfOperation: OPEN 7 DAYS A WEEK  11am to 6pm  Tours Everyday at 12, 2 & 4  Call ahead to reserve your spot!

name: Žatec Brewery
description: Dear visitor,  Zatec is an area which has become famous for its hops. The first hops were grown in 1004 and the brewing followed shortly. The combination of the dark red soil, rich in ferrous oxide (which retains water) and climate allows the region to produce the award winning crop.  The Zatec brewery - built in 1801 - is situated inside the Zatec castle walls, overlooking the town and hop fields.  The brewery suffered for lack of investment during the Communist years until by 2000 the brew was hardly available even locally, much to the detriment of the Zatec economy. In year 2001 Rolf Munding purchased the brewery from a local business man and began a program of investment which has rejuvenated the brewery and improved the prospects for the beer, brewery and the people of Zatec, both as beer drinkers and brewers.  Tomas Lejsek, one of Czech Republic’s leading and most innovative brew masters has masterminded the changes, bringing together new technology, old brewing processes and pure ingredients.
streetAddress: Žatecký pivovar, spol. s r.o., Žižkovo náměstí 81,

name: Zauber Brewing Company
description: Zauber Brewing Co is a new start up MicroBrewery in Columbus, OH. How awesome is that?!?    Having Fun, Brewing World Class Beers, Making our passion & talent manifest into creating a great atmosphere for people to come and rediscover beer culture as if for the first time.

name: Zekes Brewing
hoursOfOperation: Call before visiting hours are not set currently

name: ZEOS Brewing Company
description: Zeos Brewing Company S.A is nestled in the heartland of the historic Peloponnesian Peninsula of Greece. The brewery is surrounded by beautiful orange groves and olive plantations as well as the ancient fortresses of Argos and Nafplio.    We brew premium, and not to be surpassed, five star quality beers to reflect the proud spirit of Greek people at home and world wide. As a result our ZEOS pilsner, BLACK MAK black weiss and MAK lager (aka MAKEDONIKI SYNTAGHY or BLUE MAK) beers are quickly becoming known as Greek National Beers.

name: Zephyr Brewing Co - RiNo
description: Brewery in development.  From an article on denveroffthewagon.com, "Zephyr comes from the passenger train that ran out of Denver for 35 years. Our location in RiNo is very near the train tracks that still exist and Union Station. The Denver Zephyr minor league baseball team was also named after the train and played in Denver under that name for eight years.

name: Zero Gravity Craft Brewery
description: We work daily toward the apex of artisanal flatbread and hand-crafted beer.

name: Zeta Brewing Company
description: House brewed beer and a menu featuring made to order burgers, flats, and pizzas. HD Flat screens surround the bar with an open air patio.

name: Zierholz
description: Zierholz Premium Brewery is dedicated to creating the freshest, most flavoursome beer you've ever tasted. Their beer is hand crafted in Canberra using traditional brewing techniques to enhance its distinctive fresh taste. Each brew is nurtured with care and attention to create a satisfying balance of aroma and flavour. Because it's locally made, it's as fresh as you can get. Call ahead to book a tour of the brewery. Visit Zierholz At The Brewery right next door for beer and food tasting menus.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Tue: 11:30 am - 5:30 pm  Thu: 11:30 am - 9:00 pm  Fri: 11:30 am - 11:45 pm  Sat: 1:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Zio Carlo Magnolia Brewpub
description: We're a small, local brewpub working to get our brewhouse up and running. In the meantime enjoy the finest craft beer available in Texas and beyond. To make it even better, we have a stone pizza oven and will throw a gourmet pizza your way for the total craft beer experience!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Fri: 11:30 am - 12:00 am  Sat: 11:30 am - 1:00 am  Sun: 10:30 am - 12:00 am

name: Zipline Brewing Co.
description: Proudly headquartered in Lincoln, Nebraska, Zipline Brewing Company was borne out of our passion for locally produced craft beer. Visit this page and our website at www.ziplinebrewing.com to learn more about our company and the beers we produce. You can also follow us on Twitter and Untappd. Cheers!
hoursOfOperation: Friday: 4-7pm  Saturday: 1-7pm

name: Zuckfoltzfus Brewing Company
hoursOfOperation: Wednesday, Thursday, Friday 5-9  Saturday 12-9  Sunday 12-4

name: ZümBier
description: ZümBier Company will promote, and brew 'The Beer.' We aim to be the newest beer company in Waukegan, IL since Besleys/Waukegan Brewing quit in 1916. Craft beer today is more than an adult beverage, It's an experience! Say 'Zoom Beer'

name: ZwanzigZ Pizza & Brewing
description: ZwanzigZ Brewing is a two and a half year old addition to our independently owned pizzeria that opened in 2002. Located 40 minutes South of Indianapolis in Columbus Indiana. Follow I65 to exit 68 and head 5 minutes to just North of downtown. Nestled in a residential neighborhood, we'll make you feel like home with our fresh made deck oven pizzas, calzones, sandwiches and salads. Enjoy one of our 16 beers on tap including 4 Bourbon Barrel aged beers. In our family dining room, also enjoy any of our four craft sodas.

name: Zwei Brüder Brewing
description: Zwei Brüder Brewing was started by two brothers who are passionate about beer and talented at making it too. Offering German standards you’ll love and specialty craft beers that will surprise.

name: Zythum Brewing Company
description: Zythum Brewing Company is a brewery and restaurant that is dedicated to a few basic principles: make it fresh, keep it local, and be respectful of family, customers, co-workers, environment and community.
hoursOfOperation: Fri - Sat: 4:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Żywiec Brewery
description: The brewery started brewing in 1856. It remained in the hands of the Habsburgs until nationalisation in the post-WWII communist Poland. At the beginning of 1990s a court case was started by the descendants of the original owners, who sued the Polish government demanding $77 million compensation for the nationalisation and the use of the Habsburg family name and coat of arms for marketing purposes. The case was settled out of court on undisclosed terms in December 2005.

name: ÆppelTreow Winery & Distillery
description: ÆppelTreow Winery & Distillery is a producer of small batch cider, perry and spirits.    Cider and Perry?  We use the pre-Prohibition meaning of ‘cider’, so we’re talking about fermented or ‘hard’ cider. Perry is the pear analogue to cider.  We use lots of different kinds of apples and pears in our products.  Some modern.  Some heirloom – no longer grown for stores. We make a range of styles: sparkling, draft, still/table, and fortified/dessert.  Within a style, we lean to the dry end – but also have some medium-sweet offerings.    We are also a distillery.  We use Wisconsin grown crops and wood to make whiskey and brandies.  Distilled spirits may be powerful, but they are also flexible.  They are nice neat (straight up), and even more fun in cocktails.  We encourage people to mix our products up and add their own creative touch.

name: Пятый океан
description: "The Fifth Ocean" - the undisputed leader in sales of live draft beer. Alive only natural we call beer unfiltered, unclarified, unpasteurized, no preservatives and no artificial color. Water, malt, hops and brewer's yeast.    Freshly brewed beer contains yeast cultures that create a rich taste and aroma, valuable for true beer connoisseurs.    Lively environment does not allow for pouring beer stored for a long time. Only the "fifth ocean" does not extend the life of beer processing which spoils the taste. So beer "Fifth Ocean" goes to the store in industrial equipment - mobile tanks secondary fermentation and bottled on site.    Bottled live beer can be stored for more than 3 days. Thanks to a truly magnificent natural taste and high quality - live beer "Fifth Ocean" has been recognized connoisseurs in Russia, Kazakhstan, Vietnam and China and many other places.
hoursOfOperation: Sun-Thu: 11-24  Fri-Sat: 11-06
